solution_line_template: If she takes two rest stops per each half of the journey, then she takes {num_halves_of_trip}*{rest_time_per_half}=<<{num_halves_of_trip}*{rest_time_per_half}={total_rest_time}>>{total_rest_time} hours in rest time.
With a load, at her top speed, she can travel {distance} miles in {distance}/{speed_with_load}=<<{distance}/{speed_with_load}={time_with_load}>>{time_with_load} hours.
Without a load, at her top speed, she can travel {distance} miles in {distance}/{speed_without_load}=<<{distance}/{speed_without_load}={time_without_load}>>{time_without_load} hours.
Thus, the round trip will take {time_with_load}+{time_without_load}+{total_rest_time}=<<{time_with_load}+{time_without_load}+{total_rest_time}={total_trip_duration}>>{total_trip_duration} hours.
